website_summaries.verdict: The Dish Network ViP622 and 722 are among the most fully featured and versatile high-def DVRs you can buy today.
pros: receives and records new MPEG-4 AVC programming, including local and other HD channels not available on older receivers
can record up to three HD shows simultaneously while playing back a fourth
USB port enables connections to portable media players and external hard drives to expand storage capacity
cons: Generally lighter selection of local HD and sports channels than cable
defaults to "all episodes" for EPG-initiated recordings
uglier EPG and menu system than TiVo HD and DirecTV

customer_reviews.title: very good dvr unit
customer_reviews.text: Due to the limitations of the DISH Hopper system I went back to individual DVR's. I was renting the ViP922 before the Hopper system came out and this is what I went back to since it didn't work out with the Hopper system. This is a good unit witha fair amount of hard drive space.
customer_reviews.author: Reynaldo R. Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Decent receiver, especially for the money. Relatively reliable and stable. Easy to use. Good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Roehrich

customer_reviews.title: Already have four of these.
customer_reviews.text: Last Dish DVR before "The Hopper" Already have four VIP 922's, with all the switches etc to make them work. Good picture quality, fair amount of disc space and for the most part trouble free.
customer_reviews.author: Steve D.

customer_reviews.title: Questions / Concerns Go Unanswed
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, the receiver's UHF antenna does not work. I have performed all the trouble shooting steps, changed out the remotes and still have to get out of bed to change the channel. When the channel does decide to work, which is rare..it hops 5 channels making it almost impossible to select a channel. I expressed my concern and still no reply. Beware.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: 922 sling loaded dvr
customer_reviews.text: Before buying the SlingLoaded HD DVR, I wanted to know about the hard drive and how many GBS it had. The detailed description doesnt let you know;I contacted Dish Network for more info and I strongly advised anyone who purchases this product do the same, but its definitely worth the purchase price. It has perfect graphics,no lacking, and the sling works great.Also,the DVR receiver has the ability to work on multiple tvs at once. Thanks, Micheal Carson
customer_reviews.author: micheal carson

customer_reviews.title: review
customer_reviews.text: was everything I expected only problem was hooking it up with no schematics, had to call dish for help setting up
customer_reviews.author: sarah martin

customer_reviews.title: VIP 922 Bad news for external drive users.
customer_reviews.text: I just received a 4th Generation replacement for my 3rd Generation Vip 922. The new VIP922 will not read any of the files off of any of my external drives even though they were recorded from the old VIP 922. My understanding is that this technology is what the Hopper is based on, so buyer beware if you like to use an external drive to archive your shows you probably don't want to be in the same situation I am in. I have about 13 2 TB drives full of shows that are now useless. By the way, Tech support spent hours trying to help, they were not able to help me with this problem. Ralph J. Fitcher
customer_reviews.author: Rodney C Walmer

customer_reviews.title: Sling features on PC=Awful, Sling features on iOS devices=Pretty Nice
customer_reviews.text: (Rating is for the Sling remote capabilities, I would rate the DVD overall as a 3-star product.) As others have stated, the Sling functionality is fraught with issues and extremely frustrating when accessing via Windows (especially x64). I would recommend that you don't bother, unless you like your blood pressure to go up. However, works darn good on my iPad 2, either on the same local network as the DVR or remotely.
customer_reviews.author: S. Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Stopping at 3
customer_reviews.text: For anyone thinking about getting this unit....if you value your time and money don't do it. I've just had my third 922 die on me and Dish just wanted to send me a fourth unit. This piece of equipment is A poor piece of equipment. I should mention that it's not even been a year since getting the first unit. PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THE VIP922!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike from Amazon

customer_reviews.title: POS
customer_reviews.text: Was told by the Dish retailer that this would eventually work with two TV's. Like the VIP722, so far not so. Dish support doesn't know what they are doing or what the device is capable of. I can get the DUO MODE and the Modulator to display a second program on the set in the second room but the RF part of both remotes are dead. Only the IR part of the #1 remote works. Disk tech support couldn't even get me this far in the Trouble Shooting. Each time I try to get someone in second Level Support the phone magically disconnects. Dish and there product Sucks!!!! Half a Star is the actual rating I would give.
customer_reviews.author: markmark

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Sling Operation on Dish VIP 922
customer_reviews.text: It is a mistake to spend extra money on this receiver. I say so because I made that mistake. Sling operation is extremely poor both in video quality as well as software funtionality. I spent little over 7 hours on the phone with tech support and went through two units without any redress. Finaly, I was advised to wait for few weeks to see if the manufacturer may address the problems. Five months later I am still waiting
customer_reviews.author: M. Aslam Malik

customer_reviews.title: Great DVR
customer_reviews.text: Great DVR. Wish dish still sold it. Better than the 722k model
customer_reviews.author: JTRiker9

customer_reviews.title: TV anywhere
customer_reviews.text: This is the best tv receiver I've ever owned. Everything about it is better than the others. Yes, the TV anywhere is a bit buggy, but it works. I wouldn't go back to the 722. All of Dish networks receivers should look and work like this. They upgraded me free.
customer_reviews.author: BrettT1

customer_reviews.title: Best DVR Period!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this DVR for about 6 months. The DVR was buggy but has been fixed within last year with software updates. The GUI is great and it works just as well as my old 722k.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer P Follenius

customer_reviews.title: Not me
customer_reviews.text: Thanks all for reviews, will never be a customer of Dish.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Btown

product_meta.title: Dish Network ViP922 High Definition Dual Output SlingLoaded DVR
product_meta.description: With 1080p Video on Demand andstunning DISH Network HD programming, the model ViP922 receiver revolutionizes the way customers watch and enjoytheir favorite programming! For more information on the model ViP922 receiver, including pricing and features, pleasecontinue reading belowViP922 DVR Receiver Dual-tuner, one-TV receiver SD and HD output on TV1 1 terabyte (TB) hard drive Universal 32.0 UHF-2G configurable 4-componentremote control Capacitive-touch front panel controlsThe model ViP922 receiver features a graphics-rich user interface that isboth stylish and functional. Exciting new features include: Colorful and distinctive tile-based menus (see left) make it easy forusers to find what you are looking for with the click of a button. Easily navigate the programming guide, DVR and TV-viewingoptions. Quickly find your favorite channels with network logos and viewposter art for movies and TV shows. Home Media allows users to access supported media, includingpictures and music, from equipment on their home network (excludes streaming video)
feature_bullets: Sling Loaded so you can watch TV from any Internet connection in the world.
Change channels from anywhere with on screen remote.
The largest hard drive in the industry: a dual-tuner, one terabyte (TB) DVR with up to 1,000 hours of recoding time
Powerful search capabilities, including the ability to quickly search thousands of listings across the Program Guide,
Intuitive timer creation and DVR management allows users to categorize programming by groups (video source, title,

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.4 out of 5 stars46 ratings3.4 out of 5 stars
